channel.title: Problem with next java bot
channel.description:
I looked and tryed to acces runscape on the proxy http://anonymouse.org/ and I found that you can only access runescape now if it says http://www.runescape.com in the address bar. Why not try it yourself. It wont let you go on runesacape unless it is actually on the ruinescape site. This may, or may not, bugger all bots for the future so watch out!
EDIT -> This only happens when you go onto the game itself and here is the error:
Error_game_invalidhost - Incorrect website. This game does not appear to be loading from the correct website.
Please make sure you are playing from: http://www.runescape.com
Remember to keep your account secure NEVER enter your password anywhere except runescape.com.

item.title: Problem with next java bot
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Almost all proxies can’t use java, and often they cant even display flash. By that I mean those crummy CGI web proxies.

Read full topic

@krimson_eagl wrote:

My school firewall blocks proxy sites as ‘Loopholes’ but just goto boredatschool.net.redirect.keljob.com and goto runescape from there.

item.title: Problem with next java bot
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Yeah I am positive that once this new engine gets deob’ed properly, this can be removed from the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with next java bot
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

Im not sure about the new client but in the old one this was a trappy thingy

if(s.endsWith("127.0.0.1")) flag = true; if(!flag) { aBoolean1176 = true; return; }
This thingy would make the error below if the site wasnt correct

if(aBoolean1176) { aBoolean831 = false; g.setFont(new Font("Helvetica", 1, 20)); g.setColor(Color.white); g.drawString("Error - unable to load game!", 50, 50); g.drawString("To play RuneScape make sure you play from", 50, 100); g.drawString("http://www.runescape.com", 50, 150); }
Is that the message?

Yes it could be taken out easily (on the old engine) but you’d have to edit the (NEW) deob, It should be similar though

Read full topic
